src_text: As NSA, he assisted Carter in diplomatically handling world affairs, such as the Camp David Accords, 1978; normalizing US–China relations thought the late 1970s; the Iranian Revolution, which led to the Iran hostage crisis, 1979; and the Soviet invasion in Afghanistan, 1979.

prompt:
[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.

src_text: Since 1988, ballot boxes must be transparent so that voters and observers can witness that no envelopes are present at the start of the vote and that no envelopes are added except those of the duly counted and authorized voters.
ref_text: Ɛfiri afe 1988 mu, wɔhwɛ sɛ wɔde abatoɔ adaka a ɛmu da hɔ pefee bɛdi dwuma sɛnea obiara bɛhunu sɛ abatoɔ no rehyɛ aseɛ no, na biribiara ɛnni mu na afei nso obi foforɔ biara nso ntumi nfa krataa bɔtɔ nkɔ to mu gye sɛ wɔn a wɔwɔ ho kwan sɛ wɔto aba.
hyp_text: Ɛfiri 1988, ballot boxes deɛ a wɔbɛyɛɛ wɔn mu na wɔde wɔn abɔnten kɔɔ kyerɛɛ wɔn na wɔn nsafoɔ no a ɛbɛyɛ a wɔbɛyɛɛ wɔn abɔnten a ɛbɛyɛ a wɔde kyerɛɛ wɔn sɛ wɔbɛkɔɔ abɔnten so, na wɔde wɔn abɔnten kɔɔ kyerɛɛ wɔn sɛ wɔbɛkɔɔ abɔnten so.

src_text: Candidates can send representatives to witness every part of the process. In the evening, votes are counted by volunteers under heavy supervision, following specific procedures.
ref_text: Wɔn a wɔrepɛ tumi no wɔ ho kwan sɛ wɔbɛma obi akɔhwɛ abatoɔ no dwumadie no so bi ama wɔn. Ɛduru anwummerɛ a, wɔtu nnipa ma wɔkan aba no berɛ a abatoɔ mpanimfoɔ no nso hwɛ ma wɔkan no pɛpɛɛpɛ.
hyp_text: Ɛyɛ adeɛ a abɛnhyɛɛfoɔ kyerɛkyerɛfoɔ bɛbɛn abɛnhyɛɛ no akyɛ. Ɛdɛn, afei nso abɛnhyɛɛfoɔ a wɔyɛ adwuma wɔn ho mma nnipa abɛnhyɛɛfoɔ no so a wɔbɛyɛ ɛnyɛ sɛ wɔbɛma wɔn ho mma nnipa a wɔyɛ adwuma no ho mma, ɛnyɛ sɛ wɔbɛma wɔn ho mma nnipa a wɔyɛ adwuma no ho mma.

[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.

[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.

prompt:
[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

src_text: Crown Office, which is in overall charge of prosecutions, has indicated to journalists that no further comment will be made at least until indictment.
ref_text: Crown Office a ɛhwɛ mmaratofoɔ nsɛm nyinaa so no, aka akyerɛ nsɛmtwerɛfoɔ sɛ wɔnka ho asɛm biara kɔpem sɛ ɛbɛda adi sɛ wayɛ mfomsoɔ.

src_text: The document, according to the leak, will refer to the borders dispute, which Palestine wants based on the borders before the 1967 Mideast War.

prompt:
[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

prompt:
[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

prompt:
[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

hyp_text: Eyiɛsɛɛ King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette, wɔn abɔdin krɔfoɔ (11 afeɛn a ɛtɔ so du num Marie Therese ne 4 afeɛn a ɛtɔ so nwɔtwe Louis-Charles) ne King Louis XVI abusuafoɔ, Madam Elizabeth, 6th October 1789 mu no, wɔn nyinaa yɛɛ kɔɔ Paris a ɛwɔ Versailles a ɛbɛtumi kɔɔ Paris no ho nkyɛn wɔ market women a ɛwɔ ahoɔden so.

prompt:
[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

src_text: One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up.
ref_text: Kwan baako a wɔgyina so de kyerԑ ‘socialization’ ho mfasoɔ ne sԑ wɔbԑfa nkwadaa ho nsԑm a ankɔ yie, nkwadaa a wɔpoo wɔn, wɔn tiri anyԑ yie, wɔdii wɔn ani, na mpanimfoɔ ankyerԑkyerԑ wɔn wɔ berԑ a na wɔrenyini no ho.
hyp_text: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
prompt:
[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

src_text: Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project.

prompt:
[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

src_text: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes).

hyp_text: Wɔn a wɔn animfoɔ yɛ Australopithecus no, wɔbɛyɛɛ ɛwɔ asɛm a wɔde wɔn animfoɔ adi wɔn animfoɔ no mu a wɔbɛyɛɛ wɔn animfoɔ ho dawuro a wɔbɛyɛɛ wɔn animfoɔ no ho dawuro.
prompt:
[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

hyp_text: Nnipa a wɔn nhyehyɛe no bɛnhyɛɛ ho sɛnea wɔfrɛ no Declaration of Independence no bi a ɛtɔ so mmienu wɔ Independence Hall 8 July.
prompt:
[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

prompt:
[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.

[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.

[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.

[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.

[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.

prompt:

hyp_text: Sɛnea wɔfrɛ no, ɛyɛ ɛnɛ a ɛbɛyɛ a ɛyɛ ɔbarima abɔdeɛ a ɛwɔ nnipa mu num mu a ɛkɔɔ so no.
prompt:
[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

src_text: Sadly, as newer methods of writing have emerged, the pencil has been relegated to lesser status and uses.
ref_text: Awerɛhoɔsɛm ne sɛ, atwerɛ ho akwan ahodoɔ pii na aba, twerɛdua abɛyɛ adeɛ a yɛdeyɛ nnoɔma a ɛba fam.
hyp_text: Nanso, wɔn nni abɛka ho nnyi nhyehyɛeɛ a ɛwɔ mma no so, wɔde pencil bɛhwɛ a wɔnfrɛ no ho nnyi ase na wɔde no abɛyɛ mfeɛ a wɔde no abɛka ho nhyehyɛeɛ so.

[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.

[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.

[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.

[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.

[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.

[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.

prompt:
[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.

[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.

src_text: Today, Timbuktu is an impoverished town, although its reputation makes it a tourist attraction, and it has an airport.

[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.

[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.

hyp_text: Ɛbɛyɛ sɛ adwumayɛfoɔ no nyinaa a wɔbɛbɔ abɔdeɛ no a wɔde wɔn nsɛm a wɔde wɔn adwumayɛ ho bɛtumi akyerɛ nnipa no ho a wɔde wɔn adwumayɛ ho bɛbɔ abɔdeɛ no a ɛtɔ so mmiɛnsa,500 na ɛtɔ so mmiɛnsa,130,000, a wɔde wɔn adwumayɛ ho bɛbɔ abɔdeɛ no a ɛtɔ so mmiɛnsa,000 a ɛyɛ nnoɔma a ɛbɛyɛ a ɛyɛ adwumayɛ ho.
prompt:
[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.

[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.

[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.

[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.

prompt:
[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.

[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.

[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.

src_text: Some cruises feature Berlin, Germany in the brochures. As you can see from the map above Berlin is no where near the sea and a visit to the city is not included in the price of the cruise.
ref_text: ‘Nsuhyɛn’ no binom de Berlin, Germany ka ho wɔ nwoma no mu. Sԑdeԑ ԑwɔ ‘map’ a wohu no soro hɔ no mu no, Berlin mmԑne ԑpo no baabiara ԑnna sika a wohia de akɔ hɔ no nka ‘suhyɛn’ no boɔ no ho.
hyp_text: Nanso, wɔn akwasafoman a ɛfa Berlin, Germany no bi. Sɛ wɔbɛyɛ sɛ wɔwɔ abɔdan a ɛyɛ hɔ, ɛnna Berlin nanso deɛ, sɛdeɛ wɔde map a ɛkɔ so no bɛyɛ a, Berlin no yɛ ɛnɛ, na afei nso ɛnɛ sɛ wɔde abɔdan a ɛyɛ hɔ no ho dwumadie no deɛ, ɛbɛyɛ sɛ wɔbɛwɔ nanso.
prompt:
[English]: Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.
[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".

[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.

[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.

[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.

[Akan]: Nanso, nanka ɛsɛ sɛ Belgiumfoɔ ne Swissfoɔ a wɔka French no sua French ɔfranka wɔ sukuu mu, sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a anka wɔ bɛte w'ase sɛ mpo wode French ɔfranka akontahyɛdeɛ de dwuma a.
[English]: Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea.
[Akan]: Mfe ɔpepem a atwam no, nkurɔfoɔ de ahwɛyie asisi terraces wɔ asase hutuhutu, a agyina hɔ kuronkuron wɔ abotan no so a ɛma ɛpo no yɛ fɛ.
[English]: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska.
[Akan]: Wↄtoo Trans-Alaska Pipeline System a ne tenten yɛ akwansin 800 no mu berɛ a ankorɛ mpempem pii a na fango wom bu faa so wↄ Fairbanks anafoↄ fam, Alaska no.
[English]: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
[Akan]: Na εnnε bere wei mu Belgiunm fa bi ka Luxembourg ho tete no nanso εbεyε sε Belgium wↄ 1830 Belgian Revolution.
[English]: Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World.
[Akan]: Ɛfiri mmerɛ a "The Onion" hyɛ wɔn dwumadie ase, wɔabɛyɛ nsɛntwerɛkuo anokwafoɔ a yԑagye wɔn adi yie a wɔatintim nsɛm no bi wɔ krataa so, wɔsane nso wɔ wԑbsaite a nnipa 5,000,000 kɔɔ so kɔkenkann Ahinime bosome no mu, wɔbɔ nnoɔma ho dawuro na afei nso wɔde nsɛm to dwa nnɔnhwere 24 da mu no nyinaa, foforɔ a wɔde abɛka ho nso ne asase ho mfonin a ɛfa wiase ho nyinaa a ne din de "Our Dumb World".
